entry.title: Reflections at Ruriko-in・瑠璃光院の反映

link.title: Reflections at Ruriko-in・瑠璃光院の反映

entry.content:
Red and yellow through the windows, reflecting on the glossy tables at Ruriko-in.

What you don't see in the photo above, is the crowd of people all angling to take this exact shot, as shown below.

But besides this famous mirror table, there are many other vantage points for photos of the beautiful gardens here. The folks at Ruriko-in have done a great job at managing the large numbers of people so everyone gets a chance to shoot, keeping many of the windows and doors open so visitors don't have to shoot through glass, and stationing docents to gently reprimand those visitors who block the view of others.

entry.title: Leaves at the Gate・門の紅葉

link.title: Leaves at the Gate・門の紅葉

entry.content:
The exit gate at Jojakko-ji Temple in Arashiyama, Kyoto.

I loved the maple leaves in front of the traditional gate, with the warm yellow light coming from the booth selling charms (お守り).
